definition: to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt

sentences.english: Thus attacked, the Japanese would be afraid to split up.
sentences.chinese: 一遭到这样的伏击，日军就龟缩作一因。

sentences.english: Person's dead bodies that ambuscade us are entire secondhand along them to turn corpse powder to turn work to.
sentences.chinese: 伏击我们的人尸首都被他们用化尸粉化去了。

sentences.english: General Yanbei detachment of the Japanese army first ambush Guang-wu, avoid enemy more than 500 people.
sentences.chinese: 将军之雁北支队首战伏击广武日军，毖敌500余人。

sentences.english: Boss: So the Cobras could ambush him.
sentences.chinese: 这样眼镜蛇才能伏击他。

sentences.english: Sure enough, Xiao Hui were ambushed on the way.
sentences.chinese: 果不其然，萧辉在路上遭到伏击。

sentences.english: The policemen were from the southern Shi'ite city of Najaf.
sentences.chinese: 遭到伏击的警察来自南部什叶派城市纳杰夫。

sentences.english: Mutilate, Backstab, Garrote and Ambush can no longer be dodged.
sentences.chinese: 毁伤，背刺，凿，伏击不再能被躲闪。

sentences.english: Jack escapes to Italy after the opening ambush in Sweden.
sentences.chinese: 在瑞典的露天伏击之后，杰克逃亡到了意大利。

sentences.english: Acrossan open field, they could see the spot where they had been ambushed two daysbefore.
sentences.chinese: 穿过一片空地，他们可以看到两天前遭遇伏击的地点。

sentences.english: Claudius organization staff successfully ambushed Bai Dayis team.
sentences.chinese: 革老组织人手成功地伏击了白大怡所在的车队。

sentences.english: The units launch ambushes, order airstrikes and conduct night raids.
sentences.chinese: 这些军队发起伏击，下令空袭，及指挥夜间突袭。

sentences.english: The Elves of Silvermoon are ambushed on the plains of Alterac.
sentences.chinese: 银月城的高精灵在奥特兰克平原被伏击。

sentences.english: Mr. Zhao looked anguished at being ambushed by his friend.
sentences.chinese: 被朋友伏击，赵亮看上去很痛苦。

sentences.english: En route, they were ambushed by Tusken Raiders.
sentences.chinese: 在途中，他们遭到塔斯肯袭击者的伏击。

definition: to mount a sneak attack/to raid
to ambush/to lie in wait for/to lie low/ambush
to annihilate/to wipe out completely/to exterminate
to fish by casting a net/to capture/to surround and seize
to stop/to obstruct/to bar the way
